executive_summary: These typically fast-casual restaurants wed the quality and taste of full-service establishments with the speed and affordability of fast-food chains. Also, health-conscious and customizable options on bakeries' menus have attracted more customers. Industry performance has been supported by overall per capita disposable income and consumer spending growth. Nonetheless, the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic resulted in a setback for industry growth as consumers began to cut discretionary spending and limit unnecessary time spent in public. Overall, industry revenue has remained at $17.1 billion over the past five years, including an increase of 0.8% in 2023 alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Rising Health Consciousness and Small-Business Shopping Will Boost Growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The current period has marked a shift in the industry's landscape, as three of the four largest companies have come under the umbrella of one holding company. The JAB Holding Company (JAB) has pursued a rigorous merger and acquisition strategy during this period. The company has acquired Bruegger's Enterprises Inc., the Panera Bread Company and ABP Corporation. Each group operates under the franchise model, facilitating the rapid growth of small, independently operated establishments under widely recognized brand names.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Industry Offerings Grow Not Only More Health Conscious But Also More Expansive
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The industry occupies a middle ground between quick-service restaurants focusing on fast-food cuisine with minimal table service and full-service restaurants offering the full dining experience through table service and expansive menus. Cafes with specialized menu items like French pastries, including macaroons, brioches and croissants, have been especially prominent. The gourmet cupcake trend has been part of this trend, with the number of stores rising steadily over the past decade.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Small Independent Non-Employing Bakery Cafes Will Be Hindered By Franchises Expanding Into More Localized Markets.
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Large chains expand their geographical footprint while minimizing risk and capital expenditure using a franchise model. Franchisees benefit from the support of the enterprises under which their restaurants operate, including their vast geographic network and recognizable branding. To avoid price-based competition and to protect profit, these stores will target markets with more significant potential for growth like the breakfast crowd.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Independent Bakeries Focus on Their Atmosphere and the Smell of Fresh Goods to Draw Consumers
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Sourdough bread and other baked goods' meteoric rises during the early days of the coronavirus pandemic taught many bakery buyers to make simple loaves of bread at home. However, these products rarely matched the quality and convenience of a bakery loaf. As indoor dining restrictions were lifted, bakeries focused on their holistic experience: the smell of baked goods, a personal connection to a local baker and cafe staff, the community of a pleasant coworking space and a diverse range of unique creations that are difficult to match at home.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Panera has stated its expansion plans internationally and domestically over the coming years and will continue asserting its position as the top industry operator. Panera's parent company, JAB Holdings, will gain an increased market share by investing in its bakery and café chains portfolio. Franchise agreements, the preferred business model most major chains use, enable cafe chains to open many new locations with limited capital investment and lower risk. Independent bakery-cafes will only compete if they have a defined target market, a loyal customer base and a solid local reputation.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: BAKERY CAFES ATTEMPT TO ATTRACT CONSUMERS WITH EXTENDED MENUS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The industry has been most successful in targeting the lunch crowd, with most stores deriving well over 50.0% of their daily revenue and profit between 11:00 am and 4:00 pm. While this will remain bakery cafes' most lucrative time, many will aggressively target the underserviced breakfast and dinner market, helping them avoid price-based competition. Chains like Einstein Bros. and Corner Bakery Cafe have already introduced breakfast sandwiches and prioritize the morning crowd, including healthy breakfast alternatives like granola, fruit and yogurt on their menus. Traditionally, breakfast is mostly consumed at home, but consumers will increasingly eat out for their first meal as consumer spending and confidence grows. By offering dinner items, bakery cafes siphon away consumers from traditional sit-down restaurants typically visited for dinner.

Bakery cafes will still be subject to low profits as competition remains fierce, although some cafes will gain access to high profits through product differentiation. If demand remains strong, bakery cafes can raise prices if input costs inflate. Still, the relatively low cost of many baked goods ingredients helps keep revenue higher than other dining-out segments.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: NON-PRODUCT REVENUE STREAMS THAT BAKERY CHAINS CANNOT SCALE WILL KEEP MINOR BAKERIES AFLOAT
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Bakeries might offer baking classes to enhance customer engagement and share their expertise. These could range from beginner-level classes capitalizing on pandemic baking hype, or pastry design basics, or advanced.

Bakeries could hold special tasting events where customers can sample new products or seasonal offerings. This would not only give customers a unique in-store experience but also support batch pre-orders to guarantee revenue. Providing behind-the-scenes tours can show customers how their favorite products are made, give them an appreciation for the baking process and strengthen their connection with the brand. Pop-up events or collaborations with local chefs, artists, or other businesses can create a buzz and attract new customers without much capital investment. These events could include limited-edition products, working with celebrities, or community activities that link an already pleasant experience with the taste of freshly baked goods.

industry_definition: This industry comprises companies that produce flour-based food in an on-site oven for immediate consumption. Typical products include bread, cakes, pastries, pies and bagels and complementary products, including sandwiches, soups and salads. Purchases may be consumed on-site or taken to go.
key_trends: Rising health consciousness will boost growth as more bakery cafes capitalize on this trend by introducing healthy and vegan options.
More cafes have shifted focus to breakfast and dinner menu as competition in the lunch hours becomes more intensive.
Bakery cafes are subject to minimal regulations regarding food safety, employee treatment and minimum wages.
There is limited government assistance available to bakery cafes, causing struggling cafes to leave the industry during economic downturns.
Foods high in sugar are subject to lower demand from health-conscious customers, including cakes, cupcakes and muffins.
Bakery cafes have focused on the quality of bread and sandwiches to stay competitive as they pivot to serving breakfast and dinner.
Bakery cafes are distributed according to the population, concentrated in the West, Southeast and Mid-Atlantic regions.
Bakery cafes are located in metropolitan areas, most notably Los Angeles and New York City, where a large share of time-strapped working individuals live.
The highly fragmented nature of this industry makes competition between bakery cafes fierce.
Cafes that focus on catering to a niche market can partially reduce price competition pressure.
Panera has stated its expansion plans, internationally and domestically, over the coming years.
Most bakery cafes are local establishments, serving a small geographical area.
Automation has reduced the industry's reliance on labor, saving on wage expenses.
Coffee and food costs have been volatile, forcing cafe owners to keep the purchase costs down to avoid passing them on to customers.

market_segmentation.segment_description: The highest income quintile is the most health-conscious, as consumers in this demographic can afford healthier organic food options.
Demand from the Fourth income quintile is relatively stable.
Demand from the Third income quintile is relatively stable.
Demand from the Second income quintile is relatively stable.
Those in the lowest income quintile often must make significant sacrifices to afford meals away from home. This segment is also the quintiles' most price sensitive.
Businesses and government institutions provide food for their employees as an added benefit.

products_and_services.product_description: Pastries, Cookies and Cakes Have Slightly Decreased Amid the Prominence of Healthier Eating Habits
Offering a Wide Variety of High-Quality Bread and Sandwiches
The Most Notable Trend in Beverages is an Increased Emphasis on High-Quality Coffee

tier_2_suppliers: Wheat, Barley & Sorghum Farming in the US
Chicken Egg Production in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: The Highest and Lowest Income Quintiles Have Conflicting Spending Patterns
demand_determinants.determinant_description: The highest income quintile is the most health-conscious, as consumers in this demographic can afford healthier organic food options. Those in the lowest income quintile often must make significant sacrifices to afford meals away from home. This segment is also the quintiles' most price-sensitive, and these consumers are the most likely to substitute less expensive products for higher-quality bakery cafe goods. Lower-income populations were more likely to be negatively affected by the adverse economic conditions associated with the coronavirus pandemic.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Demand from the Second, Third and Fourth Income Quintiles, Businesses and Government is Relatively Stable
demand_determinants.determinant_description: While these consumers do not typically spend much on luxury food items, they contribute to steady demand for middle-range products in bakery cafes. Businesses and government institutions provide food for their employees as an added benefit.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region has the highest percentage of bakery cafe establishments, while its population percentage is around 20%.
The West region has the highest population percentage, but a lower percentage of bakery cafe establishments.
The Mid-Atlantic region has a relatively higher percentage of establishments compared to its population share.
The Great Lakes region has a relatively higher percentage of establishments compared to its population share.
The Plains region has a lower percentage of establishments compared to its population share.
The Rocky Mountains region has a lower percentage of establishments compared to its population share.

regulations_points.regulation_title: THE US FOOD AND DRUG ADMINISTRATION (FDA)
regulations_points.regulation_description: The FDA's Model Food Code, a best-practice guide to food handling and presentation, applies to this industry and is updated annually.

basis_points.basis_description: The highly fragmented nature of this industry makes competition between bakery cafes fierce.
Cafes that focus on catering to a niche market can partially reduce price competition pressure.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Panera is the only enterprise with greater than 5.0% market share
Franchises comprise a significant share of bakery cafes, resulting in a fragmented industry.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: The Industry Must Also Monitor Waste
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Ordering ingredients for food production and pre-prepared food and beverages sold in shops are typically the highest cost for bakery cafes.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Most cafes produce menu items from scratch
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Most cafes produce menu items from scratch rather than buying pre-prepared meals. Bakery cafes must purchase raw ingredients like flour, sugar, salt, eggs, oil, and yeast from wholesalers or retail outlets.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Cafe owners can only pass on a few of these cost increases
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: In the short term, cafe owners can only pass on a few of these cost increases to the consumer or client, and they must monitor menus, portion sizes, and other food service inputs.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: While bakery cafes will automate more mundane functions, labor is still crucial to success. Top-tier service remains one of the more effective methods to distinguish one's establishment from the competition.

volatility_points.volatility_description: The bakery cafes industry has a moderate level of revenue volatility. Even when the economy falters and consumer spending declines, the convenience and affordability of most of the industry's products limit any significant demand declines.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Revenue declined significantly during the pandemic
volatility_points.volatility_description: However, revenue declined significantly during the pandemic, when sit-down services were curtailed.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Steady gains in revenue through franchise growth
volatility_points.volatility_description: Steady gains in revenue have been achieved through an expanding market led by franchise growth. An aggressive expansion in franchises, especially among major players and increased consumer income have greatly benefited revenue growth.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Franchise expansion will reduce market share concentration
volatility_points.volatility_description: However, a considerable increase in franchise expansion will reduce industry-relevant revenue, reducing market share concentration.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Pastries, cookies and cakes have slightly decreased
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Pastries, cookies and cakes have slightly decreased amid the prominence of healthier eating habits. Shops in the Bakery Cafes industry are most known for their sweet treats and dessert options. As consumers grow increasingly health-conscious, bakery cafes will introduce healthier pastry and cake options like gluten-free products.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Offering a wide variety of high-quality bread and sandwiches
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Bakery cafes provide a variety of flour and wheat products to consumers, most notably bread, sandwiches, croissants, and bagels. Bakery cafes have increasingly expanded their offerings to include gluten-free and healthy alternatives to wheat products.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: The most notable trend in beverages is an increased emphasis on high-quality coffee
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Coffee is a staple of many consumers' daily routines. Bakery cafes that offer high-quality coffee can attract consumers with the hope of selling other products alongside coffee.

FAQs.question: How do you plan to compete with franchise establishments in your area?
FAQs.answer: Franchise establishments often have an advantage over other independent operators due to brand name recognition. Operators often have to find their niche in the industry in order to stay relevant. Many bakeries have been able to expand revenue by offering a more extensive breakfast menu.

FAQs.question: Are you working towards a focus on the breakfast market?
FAQs.answer: More bakery cafes are trying to corner the breakfast market and expand their offerings. This gives individuals a competitive edge over other operators.

FAQs.question: Do you have CSR practices in place?
FAQs.answer: Socially conscious consumers are more likely to frequent establishments that also seek to aid a worthy cause. Panera had a pay what you please establishment, which was directed at helping less fortunate customers.

FAQs.question: Are you offering full service at your establishments? If so, did you experience a significant decline in revenue amid the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic as a result?
FAQs.answer: Some operators cut costs by cutting back on waitstaff and busboys. Consumers often have to retrieve their food items and dispose of them by themselves. Operators that relied heavily on dine-in service are more likely to have experienced adverse effects due to the coronavirus pandemic.

FAQs.question: Are you implementing digital sales into your operations?
FAQs.answer: Major players like Panera Bread have experienced massive increases in their digital sales. Digital sales can come from automated kiosks, mobile phones, and online platforms.

FAQs.question: Are you affected by regulations requiring operators to disclose their ingredients?
FAQs.answer: A wave of health-conscious consumers has led to operators providing more healthy alternative menu options. Some laws require individuals to disclose ingredients and calorie counts.

FAQs.question: How do you deal with volatile commodity prices?
FAQs.answer: Some ingredients used in food served at bakery cafes have experienced volatile pricing, this includes items like sugar and milk. Profit is hampered by volatile commodity pricing.

FAQs.question: Have you experienced reduced profitability because of heightened minimum wage laws?
FAQs.answer: In 2021, 24 states are expected to raise their minimum wages, meaning employers will have to pay their low-skilled laborers more. Many operators have seen profit suffer, as a result.

FAQs.question: How hard is it to promote your company by word-of-mouth recommendations? Do you advertise in your community?
FAQs.answer: Many bakery cafes are local, small establishments that thrive on word-of-mouth marketing and local patronage. If an industry operator is able to develop a strong reputation for quality and service, it can operate successfully in a crowded marketplace.

FAQs.question: What services are you hoping to offer in the future, and what investment will this require? Have you worked with any design consultants?
FAQs.answer: Bakery cafes commonly attract customers via window displays of baked goods, so having an attractive product presentation enables operators to attract more walking traffic into their stores. Additionally, many operators have begun expanding menu options with further dietary options to cater to a wider market.

FAQs.question: Is your company dominant in any particular regional markets? How convenient is your business for commuters?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators that are located in high traffic areas are able to attract more first time customers into their store, which can present a competitive advantage.

FAQs.question: Do you offer healthful meal options for health-conscious consumers? How have consumer preferences affected your menu in the past?
FAQs.answer: Consumers have become increasingly aware of health issues related to weight and obesity. Increases in the healthy eating index are a threat to the industry, especially if consumers shift away from coffee consumption due to the perceived impact of caffeine on people's health.

FAQs.question: What risk management strategies are in place to soften the effect of low consumer sentiment? Do you offer any bargain meals?
FAQs.answer: Changes in consumer sentiment have a significant effect on the spending of discretionary items, including items from snack and coffee shops. During an economic downturn, consumers tend to forego higher-margin items and opt for lower-priced value products.

FAQs.question: When consumer spending is high, consumers are more likely to spend money on out-of-home food.
FAQs.answer: When consumer spending is high, consumers are more likely to spend money on out-of-home food.
